com.pb.sawdust.tabledata

Interface DataSet<T extends DataTable>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data table this data set holds.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataSet, BasicDataSet

    public interface DataSet<T extends DataTable>

    The DataSet interface provides a framework to hold a number of DataTables. By providing a central place through which the data tables may be accessed, relational information contained in a data table's TableSchema may be verified and utilized. It is expected that no more than one table with a given label (name) be placed in a given data set (hence the name "set"). However, there is no expectation nor requirement that two tables in a given data set have any relationship other than their presence in that set.

    There is some implementation flexibility in defining the relationship between data sets and data tables. Specifically, in some cases data tables may be created first, and data sets are merely containers to which the data tables are added. In other cases (e.g. SqlDataSet), the data set is the gateway through which data tables are created. Because of this, there is some redundancy in the method definitions (two addTable methods, a getTableSchema method as well as a getSchema method in DataTable). It is expected that one method will "dominate" (or be preferred over) the other, and that the implementing class' documentation will state the preferred method for use. Alternatively, one method may be unimplemented, and an UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • hasTable

        boolean hasTable(java.lang.String tableLabel)
        Check to see if this data set contains a table with the specified label.
        Parameters:
        tableLabel - The lable of the table whose existence in this data set is to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if a table with label tableLabel exists in this data set, false otherwise.

      • getTableLabels

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getTableLabels()
        Get an set of labels for all of the tables contained in this data set.
        Returns:
        the labels for all of the tables in this data set.

      • addTable

        DataTable addTable(DataTable table)
        Add a table to this data set. This will add the table in its entirety - both structure and data. This method may be unimplemented, but in that case addTable(TableSchema) must be implemented. The input table need not be of the same type as that held by this data set; this method will make the necessary conversions, as needed.
        Parameters:
        table - The table to add to this data set.
        Returns:
        the new table, as it exists in the data set.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if a table with table's label already exists in this data set.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is unimplemented.

      • addTable

        DataTable addTable(TableSchema schema)
        Add a table to this data set via a table schema definition. This will only add a table with the defined structure, data must be added using one of the various DataTable methods. This method may be unimplemented, but in that case addTable(DataTable) must be implemented.
        Parameters:
        schema - The schema defining the table to add to this data set.
        Returns:
        the new table, as it exists in the data set.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if a table with table's label already exists in this data set.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is unimplemented.

      • dropTable

        DataTable dropTable(java.lang.String tableLabel)
        Remove the specified table from the data set.
        Parameters:
        tableLabel - The label of the table to drop.
        Returns:
        the removed table.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if the table does not exist in the data set.

      • getTable

        T getTable(java.lang.String tableLabel)
        Get the table in this data set corresponding to a specified label.
        Parameters:
        tableLabel - The label of the table to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the table corresponding to tableLabel.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if no table with tableLabel exists in this data set.

      • getTableSchema

        TableSchema getTableSchema(java.lang.String tableLabel)
        Get the table schema for the table in this data set corresponding to a specified label.
        Parameters:
        tableLabel - The label of the table whose schema is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the table schema for the table corresponding to tableLabel.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if no table with tableLabel exists in this data set.

      • verifySchemas

        boolean verifySchemas()
        Verify the consistency of the table schemas in this data set. At a minimum, this should include checking that the schema is consistent with its table, and that the schema's other table references exists in the data set and are themselves consistent. Ideally, this method would also look into the data tables to ensure that the actual data relationships are also consistent (e.g. that a column which is keyed to another table's id column only contains number in the other tables id column).
        Returns:
        true if the schemas are consistent, false othewise.
